title: Email Account Messages Gone After Changing Settings
content:
Hi,

I changed the settings on an email account in Thunderbird to imap from pop3 as well as with a different host. Now everything is gone.

Is there any way to get them back? :(

Thanks for any suggestions.

ginger
creator: ginger213

title: Thunderbird stopped working
content: Thunderbird has ceased working. There has been no changes on my end, nothing different, it just stopped working. No emails whatsoever. Very, very inconvenient I dont need information as to what I can do as nothing has changed at my end. .
creator: accounts303

title: Thunderbird outgoing emails being blocked because of "spam".
content:
Hello, I have been having a problem with sending a lot of my emails over the last month. It usually starts with trying to forward an email from a trusted source to another because it contains information they want/need. Usually both are family. Even when I have paired it down to just a new outgoing email and only told the other family member that here is the address for our son and the house he and his wife are buying and the address so they can look it up I still get the following message from Thunderbird and denying to send it: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: [VO-101] Message blocked due to spam content in the message.. Please check the message and try again."

What can I do to sort this out and get my emails working again? Thank you! Stewart
creator: stewartadams

title: Cannot receive subaddressed emails?
content:
I transitioned to Thunderbird fairly recently, and I've encountered a problem with how I get certain emails. With my old email, I would have certain subscriptions signed up with a subaddressed email, or plus addressed- i.e. "email@domain.com" being the primary account and "email+netflix@domain.com" being for my Netflix account, for instance.

I've noticed that since transitioning, I don't receive any of those subaddressed emails, but when I check on my Macbook (just the default Mail application) all of them are there.

Can anyone help me understand why this is? I like Thunderbird as it's been fairly simple to set up and customize how I like to read my emails, and I'm looking for a solution to this - or an alternative.
creator: kattnip.official

title: google calendar events from e-mails are not showing in thunderbird
content:
None of the topics really apply.

I recently booked a trip and Google imported the reservations from the confirmation e-mails. They show up on my Google calendar and on my Android phone, but not in my Thunderbird calendar. This was not an issue when I booked a trip in December for January.

Why can't I see ALL of the entries that are in my Google calndar (the reservation is in the same calendar as my day-to-day events)?

title: linux 21.3 Virginia, thunderbird 115.18.0 how do i look up a contact via a street name or A zip code in all address books

creator: bullishbob

title: Thunderbird Won't Send Message due to spam content
content: On occasion when sending out a message, Thunderbird blocks it from going out due to the server saying it is (VO-1) message not sent due to spam content. It says Sending Of The Message Failed. An Error Occurred When Sending Mail. The mail server responded [VO-1] Message blocked due to spam content in the message. check the message and try again. How can I override T-bird and send these messages out.. In this specific incident, I'm trying to send my daughter a cookie recipe which has NO spam in it but T-Bird won't send it.
creator: ja8483722

title: How do I delete a message from ATT's server WITHOUT reading it, just remove it THERE?
content:
I'd like to delete certain obnoxious email feeds from the server [AT&T] upstream at the server, WITHOUT downloading them. These are email messages that don't have an "unsubscribe" feature added. I want to make them GONE, without having anything further to do with them, or the "organizations" these sending represent. Any advice would be welcome. The option "Delete from POP3 Server" doesn't do the job [and may be the wrong thing; I don't know].

Thankx!

The Gray Cat << tmc@att.net >>
creator: WriteStuff

title: When I open an email today, I need the date to show, along with the time -- the date is supressed on today's email.
content:
I hope you don't mind if I re-ask for everyone's help.

The last time I posted this unresolved issue was July of 2016.

All I need is that on every email I open, that email will have both the date and time displayed. At present, when I open a new email received today, the date is missing (suppressed), it only shows the time. If I open an older email, say from yesterday, the date and time will display just fine.

This simple request is to always have the date showing on every email, including today's email, where the date does not display.

Rationale: I open every email the same day received (100+ per day) and none show the date. Most are responded-to and closed. Some emails are part of multi-day projects and will remain open until the project completes, perhaps several days or a week later, being repeatedly looked at for details during phone calls or portions copied to others by email --- but none show the date, which is frequently critical to prioritizing their importance. They are left on a monitor like organized post-it notes, always in view, looked at many times a day for reference against the project they are related to. The only way to get a date to show, is to wait until the next day, and close-reopen each and every email --- it's a real nuisance.

Thank you to everyone who's trying to help, It's very appreciated.
creator: chart

title: Import from Outlook 2024
content: Hi, I have Outlook 2024 and not able to Import all my files to Mozilla Thunderbird. I click on Import from Outlook, it churns then closes Thunderbird. Appears my calendar imported but do not see any of my Personal Folders. Help would be much appreciated. Thanks, Arnie
creator: arnie5
